Kim Hyesoon

content:
Mother Language is the only way to touch your feelings & expressions
If you want to conquer our hearts give importance & respect to our mother language

Sindhi must be implemented as National language in Sindh
It must seem on ground not in papers only

content: Long story short: if we are to #StopHindiImposition, let's start by calling out casual linguistic chauvinism in the media. No, it's not okay for someone to believe that speaking Hindi is okay since they assume everyone else understands it. Break that subliminal imposition first.
translated: Long story short: if we are to #StopHindiImposition, let's start by calling out casual linguistic chauvinism in the media. No, it's not okay for someone to believe that speaking Hindi is okay since they assume everyone else understands it. Break that subliminal imposition first.

content: When we want to #StopHindiImposition, we make the issue out to be a conspiracy to infiltrate schools & get everyone to learn a language out of compulsion, not choice, especially in the south, where Hindi is hardly spoken. The reality is less dramatic and more worrying (THREAD)
translated: When we want to #StopHindiImposition, we make the issue out to be a conspiracy to infiltrate schools & get everyone to learn a language out of compulsion, not choice, especially in the south, where Hindi is hardly spoken. The reality is less dramatic and more worrying (THREAD)

There are 22 official languages in India. Hindi, Bengali, Marathi, Telugu, Tamil, Gujarati, Kannada, Odia, Malayalam, Punjabi, Assamese are majorly spoken by the native people. Hence India has 22 major languages with Hindi having no national language status.
#StopHindiImposition

content:
There are 22 official languages in India. Hindi, Bengali, Marathi, Telugu, Tamil, Gujarati, Kannada, Odia, Malayalam, Punjabi, Assamese are majorly spoken by the native people. Hence India has 22 major languages with Hindi having no national language status.
#StopHindiImposition
translated:
There are 22 official languages in India. Hindi, Bengali, Marathi, Telugu, Tamil, Gujarati, Kannada, Odia, Malayalam, Punjabi, Assamese are majorly spoken by the native people. Hence India has 22 major languages with Hindi having no national language status.
#StopHindiImposition

content:
Hindi is no national language! It's an important regional language just like Bangla, Tamil, Telegu, Punjabi, Malayalam or any of the other 22 OFFICIAL LANGUAGES in India. Let us all have pride on our mother tongue and do not bow down to hegemony.
#StopHindiImposition
#HindiDiwas
